MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Come on, everybody! Let's sing today!

Verona takes the children to a hilltop where there's a pleasant breeze.
It'll be so nice to sing here.
But Verona has chosen this place not only because it feels good. She's trying to recreate the scene of the opera with the ideal teacher. That's why she has a guitar in her hands.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Well, let's start with The Scale Song today♪
I will sing, so if you feel like singing, come on in!

Verona sits down on the grass and picks up her guitar. The children gradually become happy and naturally join in the singing. Up to this point, although the lines are completely different, she's able to play the role of a teacher who gently guides children.
Since that day, Verona's role as a teacher has gradually brought smiles to the children's faces. A few days have passed, and now all the children look forward to her class.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Come on, everyone, let's sing~♪

The joyful singing voices of the children echo through the air.
They are so full of energy that I can't help but smile just listening to them.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Okay everyone, who had fun singing today~?
At Verona's question, the children raise their hands in unison. Seeing so many smiling faces, I realize that the reconstruction of the village, which has been affected by the Mist, is progressing.

But there is one piece of sad news for the children.
Verona's time as a teacher is up. It's up to her to decide how to tell them.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Hey, guys, I have something important to tell you today.
You see, I...

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: I'm...ummm, today I'm saying goodbye to you guys.

Verona stops playing the role of teacher to the children
who are trying to listen seriously. Her unusual tone and words made them start to fidget.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
I'm sorry I'm telling you this suddenly.
I'm a Train Knight with the SSS. I have to go to another job now.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
I wanted to get to know you all so much
and sing so many fun songs with you, but now I have to say goodbye.

Verona's words of apology are quiet
and drowned out by the disappointed voices of the children.

But then one of the girls shouts for everyone to be quiet
and admonishes everyone to listen.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Thank you. Umm, aren't the mountains you can see from here really beautiful? But I can't go near them because of the Mist. It's such a beautiful place and it's a waste, don't you think?
The children mutter in agreement at Verona's words.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: I want to clear the Mist. And I want to sing with everyone again in a world where we don't have to be afraid of the Mist. I'll do my best so that everyone can smile all the time...so...
The sadness of saying goodbye to the children makes Verona break, and she is at a loss for words. Still holding back her tears, she tries to say the next words, but they don't come out.

The children wait slowly for Verona's next words,
none of them raising their voices.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: ...I'm sorry, it's all right now.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: There is one last thing I want to tell you. No matter how hard it gets, if you and this village don't give up, you can smile again.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: So please, don't let the Mist get you down.
With a little tear in the corner of her eye, Verona talks to them with a smile. All of the children nod their heads in agreement.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: They're all good, honest kids...

We're in the train returning to St. Iris.
Verona mutters quietly as she looks out the window.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: I couldn't be an entertainer until the very last moment, though.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: I wish I could have conveyed the message of not letting the Mist get them down. But I wasn't ready yet, and I didn't think I could convey that as a teacher.

I see. So you went back to the plain old Verona.
I think it was the right thing to do.
That's my personal opinion.

There are certainly many situations where I've been saved by being told cheerfully to not give up. But for those children who have just suffered the damage of the Mist, I think it's more effective if they are told sincerely, as you did. So the children probably understood it properly, right?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Yeah. They were smart, good kids, and they understood me.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Argh, I told the kids not to lose, so I can't stay down forever!

Trying to get over the loneliness of parting,
Verona stands up vigorously and puts her hand on my arm.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Come on, Conductor, join me~! La la la♪
With the clattering of the rails as her accompaniment, Verona belts out an impromptu song. There are no lyrics, but that's okay.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
One day, I'm going to clear the Mist.
I'm going to be able to take any role and deliver it with real feeling!
